review_title: Great place to work and learn!
job_title: Mental Health Court Specialist in North Fort Myers, FL
pros: Training sessions, helping the clients, manager was engaging and collaborative. Was a positive experience - felt like I contributed to really helping others.
cons: There were no cons for me when I worked there.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Sarasota, FL
pros: Helping people, helping community a plus
cons: Poorly run, questionable ethics, low pay

job_title: Clinical Nurse Specialist in Sarasota, FL
pros:
Some great associates and MD partnership professional relationships.
Can use all your skill set, assessment, psychiatry, IM injections, Pediatric clients, and Adults, Geriatric mix.
cons:
CEO kind, personable at the time.
Executive management disorganized, unengaged with staff, cliquish, micromanaged when their knowledge based lacked, unethical when in a challenging jab, love to belittle those they jealous of.
Coastal than financially STOPPED matching 401K all together, TOOK AWAY some paid holidays, FROZE any pay increase, than gave working staff an immediate  10% SALARY PAY CUT across the board to help their mismanaged finances.
They initially gave the RN overtime pay, ten accused PTO but CHANGED IT ALL and looked the other way when overtime hours were given and ironically and unethically wrote people up for LACK OF TIME MANAGEMENT.
Unfortunately a lot of good doctors, psychiatrist, Nurse managers, RN's, Case Workers had to leave due to constant changing of mid management, and poor upper management, and CFO
Finally invest in staff training, promotion, and retention.

pros: Coastal provides a very significant service for those in need of mental health services, and by accepting Medicaid, it services those who otherwise would not have access to treatment.
cons: Clinicians currently use a computer program to record bio-psychosocial assessments, treatment plans, and progress notes, and it's not especially user friendly.  It should be replaced in April of next year, and the going should become easier.  Until then, clinicians must endure.

pros: Dedicated and loyal colleagues with a passion for social services
cons: Overworked, severely underpaid, and no real sense of community or team building in a very stressful environment

pros: None. This company has no pros. The only pro that I could give is that at least it pays something, even though the rate is so poor
cons: Many...layoffs, pay cuts, disgruntled staff...The CSU is run by the techs and discharge planners. The benefits package is horrible. It's better off to pay out of pocket!

pros: Staff were helpful and pleasant to office
cons: Pay Was not enough for job

pros: Friendly staff, Techs are a great help when locating patients.
cons: Safety violations, rapid turn around rate, Nurses over worked

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Savannah, GA
pros: Chance to have alot of one on one with patients
cons: Pay, staffing, safety, management , lazy nurses, check could be messed up for several checks in a row
